title: Software Solutions Architect
description: Applicant must have 5 years of relevant experience with the following: Research, design, document, build, and pilot prioritized topics for value focused delivery. Work closely with DTMB and Vendor Development, Infrastructure, and Service Delivery teams to understand their needs and ensure the best cross agency standard is implemented. Work closely with DTMB and Vendor development teams to pilot and prove out new technical recommendations. Drive the identification, development, and implementation of key new standards in areas such as: Performance Testing, Security, Event Management, Web UI Framework, .NET Design Standards, Application to Application Communication, Caching, etc. Propose new standards/guidance based on business need, IT need and technology advances. Assist development teams to implement the standards into business applications. Investigate new technology and techniques that should be developed into an agency enterprise architecture standard. Operate as business savvy technical leader across the organization. Influence development teams to design high-quality technical solutions that fit the Enterprise Architecture and standards. Educate application development managers, developers, and business analyst on State Enterprise Architecture Standards. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard (including Legacy, Core, and Emerging technologies), business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Participate in the development of RFPs. Assist in deployment and management of end-user reporting tools and platforms. Work with IT and business project teams to understand reporting and data warehousing requirements and propose solutions. Document and provide knowledge transfer to the rest of the Enterprise Reporting Team for all solutions. Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision; typically reports to a project manager. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.

title: Senior Julia Programmer / Analyst (REMOTE)
description: Employment Type Full time Shift Description: (Sorry we cannot sponsor an H1b visa nor support a STEM OPT EAD for this role.) POSITION PURPOSE Designs, codes, tests, debugs and documents major system modifications, interfaces, or system integration solutions. Troubleshoots and provides problem resolution support to complex production/program errors or interface issues. Installs custom-built released application software upgrades. Works with business owner to understand business requirements. Serves as a mentor providing technical application expertise for the development, enhancement, customization, and maintenance of internal custom-built software applications. Skills will include development of user interfaces, database queries, extracts and understanding programming functional business logic. Will also be responsible for following business and technical requirements gathered from the business partners for coding, testing and promotion of code using Julia programing technology stack JavaScript proficient with React.js(such as Flux or Redux and agile development methodology. Familiarity with code versioning tools such as GIT, Bitbucket. Essential Functions Provides technical expertise to team members, business analysts, management and clients. Serves as a mentor to less experienced team members. May assist team lead with new candidate interviews, associate performance reviews, project scope analysis and implementation. Designs, codes, debugs, tests and implements major programming modifications, changes and new development to custom-built applications, interfaces, integration or middleware software, legacy or integration systems. Conducts impact analysis of modifications and changes to existing systems and corresponding interfaces. Conducts moderate to complex analysis, programming and design tasks Develops and maintains programs, job control language or interface solutions in accordance with predefined standards, functional and technical specifications or utilizing specialized software. Troubleshoots and resolves complex system or interface failures and issues. Applies fixes or work-a-rounds to vendor software or interfaces as needed. Interfaces with vendors as necessary. Provides support and maintenance as needed. Analyzes, installs and tests new releases to application software. Applies regulatory releases and federally mandated changes to applications software. Retrofits releases to existing modified and/or customized applications, interfaces or integration. Documents new processes and develops functional and technical specifications; provides product demonstration and training. Participates in system conversions and provides technical production support (i.e., create new programs, implement conversion rules, conduct data extracts, support batch cycles, generate ad-hoc reports, etc.), or interface retrofits as identified by statements of work (i.e., development and maintenance of real time and batch interfaces, processing downloads and other operational processes.) Interfaces with other TIS support or end users in determining business needs, translating functional requirements to technical solutions; gathering and exchanging information, program or interface testing, scheduling delivery dates, establishing necessary processes and coordinating problem resolution. Knows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision and Values in leadership behaviors, practices and decisions. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations; the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct; as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior. Performs other duties as assigned. [pay range $82,829.3778 - $124,244.0667] Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or certification in healthcare or information technology and a minimum of five to seven (5-7) years of application development using Java Script, Julia SQL, Store Procedures, Shell scripts, technology experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Advanced to expert technical proficiency, client server, two or more programming languages, related applications, tools and utilities. Considerable knowledge utilizing vendor healthcare applications, products and tools preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong knowledge of the application and the business line being supported. Ability to serve in a routine mentoring role and provide technical guidance to staff. Ability to provide staff support for business and technical projects, assignments and analysis. Ability to manage projects. Ability to work independently on a day-to-day basis. Strong customer service skills. Ability to interface with internal business analysts, information technology analyst, hospital client users and external vendors. Excellent organization, analytical, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Must possess a willingness to learn and develop skills. Must possess the ability to work in teams and with direct supervision. Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment. A personal presence which is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health. Physical And Mental Requirements And Working Conditions This position operates in a typical office environment. The area is well lit, temperature-controlled and free from hazards. Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the telephone, with people in a number of different locations on technical issues. Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communications. The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same period and adapt to interruptions. The incumbent must be capable of traveling in the course of completing project assignments. (may or may not apply) The incumbent may provide 24X7 on-call support for software application, which includes applying fixes and quick resolution to production or interface problems, errors and issues; disk space problems on server; program code, etc. Responds to high-risk situations, unknown failures and critical restorations. Documents “fix-it” procedural guides for technical support team members. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties so assigned. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law. 00499053

title: Programmer Analyst 3 - PowerBuilder Developer
description: Hello, Hope you are doing good. Position: Programmer Analyst 3 - PowerBuilder Developer Location: Lansing MI (Hybrid) Duration: Long Term Client: State of MI Job ID: 132204 Job Description: Top Skills & Years of Experience: Resource must have a high level of SQL query writing skills to write complex queries to pull data from a Sybase and MS SQL Server database - 10+ years. T-SQL Query Writing - 10+ Years. Must have experience documenting and performing unit testing - 10+ Years. PowerBuilder Development (version 7 or higher) - 5+ Years. Experience working with source control technologies such as TFS/Azure DevOps, or GIT. - 5+ Years. Please add a link to the candidate's LinkedIn profile at the top of the resume. This is required by the manager for this posting. A cover letter that highlights the candidate's experiences and skills related to the job is required. This is separate from the SOMI coversheet and should be attached as a separate document. Please do not include any persona/contact information (phone number, address, email). Prescreening questions are attached and are required for this posting. Please attach these to your submission. Looking for a PowerBuilder Developer and IT Analyst with a strong background specialized in PowerBuilder Development (version 7 or higher) and possess advanced skills in T-SQL query writing for Sybase and MS SQL Server databases. Day to day activities include data management, source control (TFS/Azure DevOps, GIT), unit testing, documentation, testing, production support, change management, software development and data integrity. Minimum Qualifications: Some college preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline PowerBuilder Development (version 7 or higher) Work in a hybrid office Willingness to learn Research and modify PowerBuilder source code to document the steps the application uses with data. Resource must have a high level of SQL query writing skills to write complex queries to pull data from a Sybase and MS SQL Server database. Must have experience developing processes to extract and manipulate data to support data migration and data cleansing of application data. Must have experience in performing data profiling, data mapping, data manipulation, validation, and analysis. Must have experience working with source control technologies such as TFS/Azure DevOps, or GIT. Must have experience documenting and performing unit testing to support program changes. Must have experience creating, updating, and maintaining documentation for programs, system specs, and flow diagrams. Must be able to work with the client and/or Business Analyst to support test scenarios. Analyze and document identified problems to determine root cause and provide root cause analysis. Follow change management procedures and provide input to execute changes.

Provides assistance to management and employees. Conducts coding quality reviews for the coding department, rehab services and physician practices. title: Senior Compensation Analyst
description: Job Title: Senior Compensation Analyst - Equity and Defined Contribution Programs Location: Remote US Our Department: Trimble Corporate Are you looking to grow your career in a fast paced Technology company? About The Role We are currently recruiting for a highly skilled and experienced Senior Compensation Analyst specializing in equity compensation, equity plans, long-term incentive programs (LTIP), and 401k modeling. In this role you will be crucial in designing, analyzing, and implementing compensation and retirement benefit programs to attract, retain, and motivate top talent within our organization. What You Will Do Equity Compensation Work closely with leadership and the stock administration team to administer Trimble's equity programs, including grant processing, vesting schedules, and exercise procedures. Lead Annual Equity Award process Administer off-cycle and special grants. Conduct market research and benchmarking to ensure competitiveness and alignment with industry standards. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies governing equity compensation. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to communicate and educate employees on equity compensation plans. Executive Compensation Strategy Benchmark executive compensation elements, including base salary, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, and other executive perquisites. Assist senior leadership and the Compensation Committee in designing and implementing executive compensation strategies that align with organizational objectives, shareholder interests, and regulatory requirements. Defined Contribution Retirement Programs 401(k) and DCP Oversee the design, operations, administration, audit, and compliance requirements of the company's defined contribution retirement programs, primarily focusing on the 401k plan and NQ Deferred Compensation Plan. Manage contribution matching, investment options, compliance monitoring, and communication efforts to drive employee participation and engagement. Conduct financial modeling and analysis to evaluate the impact of 401(k) plan changes and contributions on employee retirement savings and overall compensation strategy. Attend, oversee the 401k committee meetings. Manage the committee agenda topics and ensure that the committee is informed and updated on relevant 401k administration initiatives and activities Manage 401k vendor and consultant relationships (i.e. recordkeeper, legal, investment advisors, etc) What Skills & Experience You Should Have 7 years of experience in compensation, with previous exposure to equity, executive compensation, defined contribution retirement programs, and long-term incentives Strong understanding of equity plan design, executive compensation principles, and defined contribution retirement program administration. Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis Advanced spreadsheet skills and experience with compensation management software Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively to diverse audiences. Strong attention to detail, analytical mindset, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Obtained or working towards CCP Preferred About Trimble Trimble’s core values are to provide a culture where our employees belong, grow, and innovate. In Trimble Benefits, we support this experience by providing competitive, equitable, and harmonized programs across all countries. Our benefits are inclusive and flexible assisting our diverse workforce during the moments that matter—in support of their financial, physical, emotional, and social well-being. They are aligned and in balance with the high-tech industry’s values and benchmarks. We encourage our employees to share accountability for their healthcare choices through health literacy. About Your Location Preferred location is our corporate office in Westminster, CO. We are open to locations in Portland, OR or Minneapolis, MN. Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work. We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from. Pay Equity Trimble provides the following compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that it in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position. This compensation range is based on a full time schedule. Trimble reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law. Hiring Range 99700 134600 Bonus Eligible? Yes Trimble offers comprehensive core benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Time off plans and retirement plans. Most of our businesses also offer tax savings plans for health, dependent care and commuter expenses as well as Paid Parental Leave and Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Trimble is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and embrace our candidates' diversity and take affirmative action to employ and advance individuals without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth or related medical conditions), national origin, marital status, genetic information, and all other legally protected characteristics. We forbid discrimination and harassment in the workplace based on any protected status or characteristic. A criminal history is not an automatic bar to employment with the Company, and we consider qualified applicants consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. The Company is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities, and individuals with sincerely held religious beliefs in our job application procedures. title: Enterprise Release Manager
description: At AJBoggs, people are our greatest asset! Accelerate your career today by supporting public sector organizations as a Project Manager / Enterprise Release Manager (ERM). The Enterprise Release Manager will report to the Senior Manager of Development and work closely with a team of Project Managers, Delivery Leads, Scrum Masters, Developers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, and Solution Engineers. As an ERM, you will support the implementation of complex, high-quality systems, managing a scrum of scrum, preparing detailed release schedules and managing enterprise risks. This role may be right for you if you: Are detailed oriented and enjoy coordinating multiple teams in an Agile environment. Multitask in a fast-paced environment while remaining focused. Have excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills. Requirements Your essential duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Establish and maintain release cadence and coordination activities across Scrum, Development, and cross-functional Teams Lead the release processes at the portfolio level Build and maintain Release, Sprint, and Deployment schedules Facilitate Integrated Release Planning, Release Scrums, Scrum of Scrums, and related ceremonies Ensure deployments are promoted and test activities occur within development environments in accordance with the Release Schedule Act as the primary interface with our internal teams, ensuring defined Definition of Done requirements are met by cross-functional project teams Assist in removing roadblocks/impediments for the various teams Maintain key metrics related to software development, quality, and related artifacts Manage software application releases across multiple teams Follow industry best practices and software development life cycle methodologies Maintain and expand professional and technical knowledge through research, training, and empirical testing Other duties, as assigned Required Education, Experience, Knowledge, & Abilities Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience designing, testing, and coordinating the release and deployment of multiple large scale production systems 8+ years related technical experience, including Scrum Master role 5+ years of experience as business analyst, portfolio manager, or program manager Experience managing multiple Agile teams in a portfolio or enterprise setting Experience in Azure DevOps, Jira, or Aha! in the context of software development and reporting across multiple teams; Azure DevOps expertise a plus Experience with DevSecOps processes and/or tools Experience with Agile practices such as continuous integration/continuous delivery, backlog refinement, and retrospectives Understanding of traditional software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, Change Management, Quality Assurance, and Release Management Licensing or Professional Certifications as Certified Scrum Master Benefits The salary for this position depends upon your qualifications, experience, skill levels, technical competencies, and other criteria. Straight-time overtime is occasionally available. Here are some of our other benefits: Group Medical, Dental, Life, HSA/FSA, and Vision Insurance SIMPLE IRA Accounts with an immediate vesting of 3% company match Paid company holidays and personal days Partial Internet and mobile phone expense reimbursement Collaborative and innovative work environment Professional development opportunities Hybrid/remote work arrangement (subject to change). Location & Work Environment This position is full-time/hybrid environment, you must reside in Michigan’s lower peninsula and work four days per month onsite in Lansing. At A.J. Boggs, we embrace a positive work environment by demonstrating cultural awareness, flexibility, collaboration, and creativity. We are committed to equal opportunity in employment and fostering a diverse and inclusive work culture. For more information, visit www.ajboggs.com/careers.

title: Senior Manager - Dayforce HCM
description: Job Summary JOB DESCRIPTION To support our double-digit growth goals, BDO Digital seeks a Senior Manager who will be part of an Enterprise Business Applications (EBA) team supporting projects in the areas of EBA strategy and implementation, in addition to Business Transformation and Operational Excellence efforts. This role will conduct discovery, requirements gathering, process documentation, configuration, and implementation management of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), CRM (Customer Relationship Management), HCM (Human Capital Management) and other related business applications functioning as a key resource for our clients spanning, finance, product distribution, manufacturing, job costing, field service, sales, marketing, service, and reporting. As one of Ceridian’s first Dayforce System Integrator partners for HCM, BDO has established a strong presence in North America as one of Ceridian’s most strategic partners. Our team has been rapidly growing, having increased 5x in 2022 with a rapidly expanding base of clients. Job Duties Oversees project delivery, ensuring consistent application of BDO quality and project management standards and overall project milestones are met Works in partnership with BDO industry leaders, our Dayforce Practice Leader, and our National Technology Leader, assisting in building a market plan to grow BDO’s presence in the HCM market and scale our opportunity pipeline Builds the capabilities of the delivery team, through attracting additional experienced Dayforce practitioners to BDO and developing talent new to the Dayforce ecosystem Supports strategic sales pursuits, leveraging the core team to prepare and deliver proposals, sales support material, demos & POCs, etc. Monitors and manages the financials of projects, driving profitability and mitigating risk Understands current trends in HCM processes and technologies, both current and future, and applies this knowledge in building BDO’s presence in the Canadian HCM market Drives team culture through embodying a spirit of optimism, curiosity Other duties as required Supervisory Responsibilities Owns and drives completion of key workstreams as directed by project leaders Manages project workstreams as directed Mentors and develops entry level consultants and senior consultants Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Education Bachelor’s Degree and ten (10) or more years of industry experience with Human Capital Management (HCM) systems, required; OR High School Diploma/GED and twelve (12) or more years of industry experience with Human Capital Management (HCM) systems, required Experience Ten (10) or more years overseeing a practice or team responsible for cloud technology implementations, required Five (5) or more years overseeing HCM project delivery, required Experience overseeing teams responsible for HCM implementations, preferred Experience driving sales pursuits, business development, demos and POCs, preferred Deep understanding of project financials and project governance to drive quality and mitigate risk, preferred Some client facing best practice consulting experience, preferred License(s)/Certification(s) One or more current business applications technology certifications, preferred Software Experience with one or more of the following Dayforce solutions, required: Talent Intelligence Workforce Management (WFM) Benefit Intelligence Human Resources (HR) Advanced HR Analytics Payroll Experience with Dayforce, ADP, UKG, Workday, Oracle or SAP, preferred Language(s) N/A Other Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Business process mapping experience Experience Leading and facilitating client workshops and sessions Experience engaging with clients on multiple implementations simultaneously Experience with Change Management Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills Strong analytical, problem solving, facilitation, documentation, and communication skills Business process analysis, design, and process flow skills Excels at operating in a fast-paced technical environment Keywords: Salesforce, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Finance & Operations, Dynamics F&O, Microsoft Finance and Supply Chain Management, Microsoft F&SCM, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 CRM, Microsoft Customer Experience Platform, Business Analyst, BA, Enterprise Tester, Requirements Gathering, User Experience, User Enablement, Data Visualization, Software, Definition, Custom Applications, Data Analytics, Cloud Strategy, SharePoint, Office 365, O365, SFDC, D365, Acumatica, NetSuite. OpenAir, Ceridian Dayforce, HCM, Human Capital Management Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and geography. California Range: $165,000 - $195,000 Colorado Range: $165,000 - $195,000 NYC/Long Island/Westchester Range: $165,000 - $195,000 Washington Range: $165,000 - $195,000 Washington DC Range: $165,000 - $195,000 About Us Join us at BDO, where you will find more than a career, you’ll find a place where your work is impactful, and you are valued for your individuality. We offer flexibility and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is centered around making meaningful connections, approaching interactions with curiosity, and being true to yourself, all while making a positive difference in the world. At BDO, our purpose of helping people thrive every day is at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are focused on delivering exceptional and sustainable outcomes and value for our people, our clients, and our communities. BDO is proud to be an ESOP company, reflecting a culture that puts people first, by sharing financially in our growth in value with our U.S. team. BDO professionals provide assurance, tax and advisory services for a diverse range of clients across the U.S. and in over 160 countries through our global organization. BDO is the first large accounting and advisory organization to implement an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). A qualified retirement plan, the ESOP offers participants a stake in the firm’s success through beneficial ownership and a unique opportunity to enhance their financial well-being. title: Infotainment Quality Analyst
description: Role: Infotainment Quality Analyst Location: Warren, MI Must be local to MI Duration: Long term Rate: Market Responsibilities Participate in requirement reviews in order to write test procedures and test cases Develop test cases for black/white box testing Define test strategies based on software development plans Define and maintain test plans based on software development schedule Ensure test plans align with the development schedule and project milestones Analyze reported issues to generate quality reports, and contribute to defect prevention Support development teams to verify and/or reproduce reported issues Participate in the continuous improvement of test processes and methodologies Setup and configure necessary hardware and operating environments for specialized and daily test cases Maintain of test equipment and the test library environment Participate in development of test tools and test scripts Test Data setup Test environment setup Automation of testing using selenium and other tools in market. Basic Qualifications Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical degree Minimum of 2 years of experience with proven technical and professional skills in Android and related software design, development, and testing 2+ years of experience in software quality assurance and testing Android code and backoffice distributed systems with Java/J2EE/.net and with traditional Databases and or Big data volume databases. Knowledge of SOA, Microservices and or Event based Architectures. Solid knowledge of testing embedded product software and software QA methodologies and tools Automation Testing experience using Languages (Python/ Java/ C++) Good experience with different Operating Systems, especially Linux variants Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, self-motivated, quick-thinker and able to work in a fast-paced work environment Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization Emerging partnership and collaboration skills showing ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed Consistent demonstration of innovative thinking that is customer-centric Preferred Experience Master's degree in a related technical field Advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field 5+ years of experience in quality assurance Experience in Automation Testing using tools (UI Automator), API Testing (JUnit) Knowledge of vehicle CAN based communication and use of CAN tools - CaNoE, Vehicle Spy Working knowledge of Scrum/Agile software development process Outstanding verbal and written communication skill Experience with edge, cloud, IoT technologies, operating systems, OS internals, OS design, virtualization technologies, containerization/container development Knowledge of data science, data analytic tools, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI) Knowledge of AUTOSAR standards and methodology Knowledge and experience with CAN, LIN or Ethernet communications protocol

title: Pharmacy Tech Supervisor
description: Job Summary Under the direction of the Director of Pharmacy, coordinates assigned aspects of the business, finance, quality and operational activities of the Pharmacy Department to include the administration, coordination and analysis of financial and billing policies, pharmacy operations, and assistance with I.T. functions related to these activities. Performs in an administrative support capacity. Supports and maintains business, financial, quality, and operational approved policies and procedures in collaboration with the 340b team, the pharmacy financial analyst and the Pharmacy Director. Strives for superior performance by consistently providing a product of service to leadership and staff that is recognized as ultimately contributing to the patient experience. Primary Job Responsibilities Performs the activities in support of the Pharmacy Department to include systems administration, analysis and implementation of new and existing workflows. Assists directly or indirectly all pharmacy purchasing activities in coordination with the 340b team. Assists 340b coordinator, Pharmacy financial analyst and pharmacy coordinators to oversee an effective drug-charge process. Prepares pharmacy staff schedules, technical staff reassignments or schedule adjustments as needed to maintain efficient staffing levels, monitors attendance, processes payroll, monitors scheduling expenditures, and analyzes PTO requests. Maintains technician staff by recruiting, selecting, training and orientation of employees. Accomplishes technical staff job results by coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; planning and monitoring job contributions and expectations, recommending compensation actions as result of completing performance evaluations with director. Implements and enforces systems policies, procedures, and operating instructions. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops and/or reviewing professional publications, and participating in professional organizations. Performs quality control and quality improvement activities in conjunction with the Pharmacy Director. Analyzes direct and indirect costs and determine proper allocation for recording cost elements; develop and improve methods of calculating and controlling cost; compile cost data for use in developing budget proposals; implement and monitor cost accounting procedures and manage cost systems and methods for the Pharmacy ensuring compliance with overall Hospital regulations. Analyzes, develops, and maintains computer application, procedure and other systems that satisfy the needs of the department. Assists IS pharmacy coordinator to oversee computer applications to ensure proper use, access, and security. Participates in development of departmental goals and hospital objectives. Provides general supervision over the technical staff Completes departmental projects as assigned by the Director of Pharmacy Prepares reports and analyses setting forth progress, adverse trends and appropriate recommendations or conclusions. Provides support and participates with department, hospital, and medical staff committees for matters relating to the business and operational activities of the Pharmacy Department or medication use process of the hospital. Maintains procedures for effective drug inventory management, preparation, dispensing, and charging procedures including the implementation and use of technology tools. Works independently, planning work necessary to meet the needs of the department. Responsible for supplying the Director of Pharmacy with financial, system, and implementation information regarding all information technologies. Demonstrates job related aspects of patient safety to assure a safe environment, safe and effective use of equipment and technology, and decreased risk of potential adverse patient occurrences. Demonstrates knowledge of and supports hospital mission, vision, value statements, standards of care, policies and procedures, operating instructions, confidentiality statements, corporate compliance plan, standards of behavior, and the code of ethical behavior. Serve as member of the USP 795,797, and 800 committee. Other duties as assigned. JOB SPECIFICATIONS EDUCATION Bachelor’s degree in business/information systems, health services administration or equivalent experience required. Must be a licensed and certified pharmacy technician. Experience 1 . Familiar with spreadsheet applications and work processing software. Minimum of three years’ experience in pharmacy computer systems preferred. Minimum of three years’ experience as certified pharmacy technician in hospital setting preferred. Additional experience with respect to medical or similar information systems desirable.

title: Senior Configuration Analyst
description: PGS Worldwide is actively seeking a skilled Senior Configuration Analyst to support ongoing projects for an Aerospace leader in Sterling Heights, MI. This is an initial 6-month contract-to-hire opportunity and I will respond immediately to all qualified candidates. Job Description Join a team responsible for performing Configuration Management (CM) activities related to the design, development, and production of complex systems in a defense environment. Work independently and as part of a team. Manage changes to approved configurations using a systematic measurable change process. Deliver and maintain the engineering technical data package (TDP) and apply CM processes in accordance with the CM Plan. Support configuration management and quality audits and develop solutions to problems of moderate scope and complexity, using guidance from company policies and procedures. Explain solutions, practices, and procedures to others in the organization according to procedure. Develop and maintain effective working relationships with functional personnel in Engineering, Quality, Logistics, Procurement and Manufacturing. Requirements Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline and 4+ years' experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Defense industry experience. General knowledge of relevant configuration management and design engineering standards, manufacturing processes and documentation including military standards MIL-HDBK-61A, MIL-STD-31000, industry CM standard EIA-649, and/or Drawing standards ASME Y14.24 and ASME Y14.100. Experience using a database. Good computer skills with MS Office Suite to prepare appropriate metrics, reports and documents. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Attention to detail, coupled with good time management and organization skills. Sound interpersonal skills for interfacing and coordinating with company personnel, customers, and suppliers. Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment. US Citizenship. Desired Formal training in Configuration Data Management (CDM). MS Excel advanced user knowledge of complex formulas. Familiarity with CMMI requirements. Ability to develop/demonstrate research and presentation skills. Experience using Windchill to manage product data. Job ID: 6583 Military veterans and transitioning military members are encouraged to apply to all PGS Worldwide positions . All of our jobs are military-friendly, and we work with leaders in Aerospace who rely on your military expertise to support mission-critical programs nationwide. As a Veteran Founded company, we know that the military has given you the skills and training you need to succeed in positions like this, and we want to support your success in the civilian sector however we can. We thank you for your service , and humbly offer our own in return by helping you take your career to the next level.

title: D365 Customer Engagement Architect
description: Job Summary JOB DESCRIPTION BDO Digital, LLC., a wholly owned subsidiary of BDO USA, P.C., is a rapidly growing digital advisory organization dedicated to helping middle-market organizations capture the full power of technology, adapt to disruption, increase operational efficiencies, improve risk management effectiveness, and uncover new sources of revenue. Our collaborative, cross-disciplinary team is comprised of digital strategists, systems integrators, data scientists, software developers, change management professionals, and industry-specific advisors who work together to solve clients’ immediate digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. Our goal is to help our clients become faster, smarter, and more resilient to change. To support our double-digit growth goals, BDO Digital seeks a manager who will be part of an Enterprise Business Applications (EBA) team supporting projects in the areas of EBA strategy and implementation, in addition to Business Transformation and Operational Excellence efforts. This role will conduct discovery, requirements gathering, process documentation, configuration, and implementation management of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), CRM (Customer Relationship Management), HCM (Human Capital Management) and other related business applications functioning as a key resource for our clients spanning, finance, product distribution, manufacturing, job costing, field service, sales, marketing, service, and reporting. providing help desk support; training users Implementation and Support: Provides functional support of EBA solutions and related technologies Manages and resolves issues, defects, and change requests Manages and performs systems configuration tasks (but not coding/development) for process workstreams as directed Provides ongoing support during project implementations and post-go-live support Responsible for configuration of solution based on requirements Fosters a positive demeanor, learning attitude and client service mentality with the team Travel – up to 25%, as needed Other duties, as required Supervisory Responsibilities Owns and drives completion of key workstreams as directed by project leaders Manages project workstreams as directed Mentors and develops entry level consultants and senior consultants Education Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Bachelor’s Degree and six (6) or more years of industry experience with ERP systems, required; OR High School Diploma/GED and seven (7) or more years of industry experience with ERP systems, required Experience Six (6) or more years of business process analysis and/or business application education or experience, required Four (4) or more years of education or experience with ERP or CRM Product, required Some client facing best practice consulting experience, preferred License/Certifications One or more current business applications technology certifications, preferred Software Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, Word, and SharePoint, required Experience with one or more ERP/CRM/HCM Solutions technology, required: Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), CRM, Business Central, F&SCM), Ceridian Dayforce Solutions (Talent & Benefits Intelligence, Workforce Management (WFM), HR, Advanced HR Analytics, or Payroll), Salesforce, Oracle NetSuite, Acumatica, SAP, Infor, Sage, Syteline, JDE, IFS, or any other ERP/CRM Software Smartsheet, preferred Enterprise software strategy, selection, and implementation experience, preferred Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Strong analytical, problem solving, facilitation, documentation, and communication skills Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills Business process analysis, design, and process flow skills Excels at operating in a fast-paced technical environment Keywords Salesforce, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Finance & Operations, Dynamics F&O, Microsoft Finance and Supply Chain Management, Microsoft F&SCM, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 CRM, Microsoft Customer Experience Platform, Business Analyst, BA, Enterprise Tester, Requirements Gathering, User Experience, User Enablement, Data Visualization, Software, Definition, Custom Applications, Data Analytics, Cloud Strategy, SharePoint, Office 365, O365, SFDC, D365, Acumatica, NetSuite. OpenAir, Ceridian Dayforce, HCM, Human Capital Management Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and geography. title: Senior Analyst, Production Supervisor
description: SC JOHNSON IS A FIFTH-GENERATION FAMILY COMPANY BUILT ON THE SPIRIT OF OUR PEOPLE. We have been leading with purpose for over 130 years, building iconic brands that win the hearts and minds of consumers – such as Raid®, Glade®, Ziploc® and more, in virtually every country around the world. Together, we are creating a better future – for the planet, for future generations and for every SCJ team member. Join our winning team of Wave Makers and Go Getters and help us write the next chapter in the SCJ story. About The Role The Manufacturing Supervisor will manage the production activities and employees across 2 shifts on straight nights schedule. Reporting to the Production Manager of a plant, this position works closely with other plant support personnel to achieve plant KPI’s, and enforce safety and quality standards. While providing leadership visibility on the plant floor, supervisors will be responsible for building rapport with team members, evaluating and mentoring their teams to increase productivity and inspire positive morale. SHIFTS AVAILABLE : Supervisors work 5 days/week, consistently on Tues-Thurs, including a rotation for the other 2 working days and days off between Fridays – Mondays 11:00pm – 7:00am 6:00pm – 2:00am Internal Candidates: This position is Graded G** Key Responsibilities Supervises shift team members, ensuring productivity, safety, and product quality. Maintains the weekly production schedules and mediates any staffing or mechanical issues. Builds the team through training, development, and positive reinforcements. Ensures business production targets are achieved. Manage labor staffing and planning for a shift by driving site priorities through staffing for flow to work. Delegates work assignments and drives shift/plant communication. Completes performance and probationary reviews for team members within area of responsibility. Maintains employee records, compliance and performance documentation, and approves timecards. Follows existing protocols and enforces internal policies. Assists in the resolution of employee conflict and discipline issues as they occur while striving for consistency and fairness. Conducts on-shift safety, quality, and production incident investigations. Partner with support functions and key personnel to keep them apprised of shift-related activity. Participate in task forces and core groups that resolve Bay City shift-related issues. Maintain a clean and safe workplace in accordance with SCJ policies, procedures, and in line with SCJ core values. Responsible for performance management write-ups and reviews for shift employees. Conduct investigations and administer positive disciplines as needed. Interview and support hiring of plant production employees. Key contact for all Bay City emergency issues as they arise on shift. Conduct site wide GEMBA walks when working weekend rotation. Promote and practice all elements of Success Drivers. Required Experience You’ll Bring 5+ years working in a manufacturing environment or University Degree and 2-4 years of relevant work experience or an advanced degree with 1-3 years relevant work experience. 1-2 years in a leadership role. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Military experience considered in lieu of education requirement. Preferred Experiences And Skills Courage - Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what needs to be said. Self-Development - Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels. Dealing with Ambiguity - Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear. Integrity & Trust - Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity. Interpersonal Savvy - Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people. Priority Setting - Providing direction, delegating, and removing obstacles to get work done. Drive for Results - Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances. Decision Quality - Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. Developing Direct Reports - Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization's goals. Building Effective Teams - Build strong teams that apply diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals. Delegation - Giving others authority, responsibility, and autonomy to make decisions and execute tasks or assignments. Demonstrated experience working within a continuous improvement environment in the areas of production, quality and Lean manufacturing principles. Open, honest communication style with interpersonal and facilitation skills. Assertive self-starter with high initiative and ability to prioritize effectively. Solid organizational and time management skills. Demonstrated ability to deliver effective coaching and mentoring. Bay City Manufacturing experience and knowledge of all operational areas. Ability to identify actionable, business critical goals that can be influenced by business work teams. Ability to convert goals into actions and execute for results. Team player who enjoys working with others and gets satisfaction from seeing others perform well. Experience leading high performance work teams. Knowledge of plant preventative, predictive and corrective maintenance activities. Demonstrate a high degree of safety awareness. Job Requirements Full time. Ability to work a variable schedule that includes weekend coverage. Working conditions may involve lifting of materials and product up to 50 pounds. Requires the use of safety equipment to include but not limited to, eye safety glasses, hearing protectors, and steel toed work boots. Exposure to noise and subject to regular bending, twisting, and reaching. This position is not eligible for remote work. Benefits And Perks SC Johnson’s total compensation packages are at or above industry levels. In addition to salary, total packages may include bonuses, long-term incentives, matching 401(k) contributions and profit sharing based on company profitability, job level and years of service. As a family company, we’re committed to providing benefits such as subsidized health care plans, maternity/paternity/adoption leave, flexible work arrangements, vacation purchase options, recreation and fitness centers, childcare, counseling services and more. Inclusion & Diversity We’re a global business, with people from every culture, ethnicity, race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age and ability. We recognize the breadth of human experience, and we work to celebrate it. It is our goal to build a diverse, inclusive and supportive work environment where all people can thrive. We’re committed to ongoing efforts that help us attract, hire, and retain diverse talent who want to build a positive, inclusive environment. Read more about our ongoing initiatives at https://jobs.scjohnson.com/inclusion. Better Together At SC Johnson, we strive to create a positive, inclusive and unique workplace. We strongly believe SCJ people are able to achieve their best when they can collaborate and work together in person. Equal Opportunity Employer The policy of the Company is to ensure equal opportunity for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, gender identity, gender expression, disability, citizenship, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in any active or reserve component of the U.S. or state military forces, genetic history or information or any other category protected by law. Accommodation Requests If you are an individual with a disability and you need an accommodation or other assistance during the application process, please call our Human Resources department at 262-260-3343 or email your request to SCJHR@scj.com. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. Download the EEO is the Law poster for more information.
